item.title: Red and yellow flags can be dangerously confusing. Is it time to change them?
item.description: Every summer, millions of Australians head to the beach and every year thousands are rescued by lifeguards or surf life savers, and even surfers or other bystanders.

item.title: The moon will loom extra large tonight — but it's not a supermoon
item.description: Stargazers will be treated with a supersized wolf moon for the first weekend of the year. Here's what to know.

item.title: The parts of Myanmar the military junta doesn't want you to see
item.description: Myanmar's military is holding its first elections since overthrowing a democratically elected government in 2021. But as it aims to portray a sense of normality, signs of the junta's menacing presence are everywhere.

item.title: Mid North Coast brumby program rehomes 160 wild horses across Australia
item.description: About a third of the brumby population on the NSW Mid North Coast has been rehomed through a program designed to give wild horses a second chance as pets.

item.title: Naomi Osaka loses United Cup match to Maria Sakkari ahead of Australian Open
item.description: Just over two weeks from the season-opening major, former world number one Naomi Osaka reveals she is not at full health after contracting a viral illness over the Christmas period.

item.title: Tesla loses title of bestselling EV company to BYD as sales drop
item.description: Tesla sales have declined for the second consecutive year, with Chinese rival BYD surpassing it as the world's largest electric vehicle maker.

item.title: Barbecue explosion prompts safety warning after Qld beautician's burns
item.description: Rachel Dear has a serious warning for anyone using a gas barbecue after she suffered significant face and body burns while cooking on Christmas Eve.

item.title: Coffee pods generate thousands of tonnes of waste in Australia. Here's what is being done about it
item.description: Between 10 and 20 per cent of the 3 million coffee pods Australians consume daily are actually recycled. Here's what's being done to change that.

item.title: Photographs of Men in Love exhibition reveals public glimpses of forbidden love
item.description: What started as a chance discovery of an old photo at a Dallas antique store has spawned a collection of more than 4,000 images of male couples, more than 100 of which are now on display in Canberra.

item.title: WA's Pilbara region shares a human and shorebird FIFO population
item.description: Dozens of shorebird species flock to northern WA for summer during their global migration.

item.title: Middle Percy Island is a 'haven' for sailors, displaying scores of memorabilia from bygone days
item.description: Middle Percy Island is a rare gem where boaties can come ashore and wander through thousands of mementos left by travellers from across the globe.

item.title: Former Darwin councillor's ex-partner speaks out after guilty domestic violence verdict
item.description: Former Darwin councillor Paul Arnold was found guilty of domestic violence after a years-long court battle, with his ex-partner refusing to be scared into silence. She said the case was "stressful and deeply humiliating", but facing her abuser had been empowering.

item.title: Storm chaser captures rare red sprites across Kimberley sky
item.description: A storm chaser says he "screamed" when he captured an elusive natural phenomenon, known as red sprites, on video.

item.title: Premium beef producers expect to be the main casualty of China's new 55 per cent tariff
item.description: Australian cattle farmers producing wagyu and Angus beef are likely to be among the hardest hit by China's 55 per cent tariff on exports exceeding a 205,000-tonne quota.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Wildlife carers warn people to watch out for puggle burrows this summer
item.description: With female echidnas seemingly creating burrows in random places at this time of the year, wildlife carers warn to keep an eye out for what might be disturbed while doing holiday work on your property.

item.title: Hunt for escaped red-whiskered bulbul that has SA's fruitgrowers worried
item.description: The sighting of a single red-whiskered bulbul in the wild might not seem like a big deal, but this invasive pest could put crops and the environment at risk.

item.title: Yemen separatists announce plan to split country after 20 killed in Saudi-led strikes
item.description: A military official from the separatist group, which is backed by the United Arab Emirates, said that 20 fighters had been killed in air raids by the Saudi-backed coalition in the south of the country.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios prepared to go through Australian Open qualifying if wildcard spot eludes him
item.description: Nick Kyrgios describes himself as a "chaotic mess, but an entertainer" as he prepares to return in Brisbane and awaits a call on his Australian Open status.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: For its 250th birthday, America is being America
item.description: It is entirely fitting that the US is so splintered on its semiquincentennial. Division, for the lion's share of its history, has been its default.

item.title: Today in History, January 4: How 'arrogant' Edmund Hillary made history again at the South Pole
item.description: Less than five years after conquering Mount Everest, legendary explorer Sir Edmund Hillary wanted to make history again in Antarctica.

item.title: Butter, margarine or nut spreads. Which is best for your home?
item.description: You might have a personal preference for which spread you use at home, but experts say there are health considerations for which one you use.

item.title: Australian exporters still grappling with 'the wild west' eight months after 'liberation day'
item.description: From de minimis to beef tariffs, Aussie exporters are preparing for another "wild" year.

item.title: Pakistan's first woman to summit K2 sparks new wave of female climbers
item.description: Pakistani women are hiking some of the world's tallest mountains and glacier trails, claiming a space that has long been out of reach.

item.title: Blak romance surges as First Nations authors rewrite love stories with 'choc-lit'
item.description: An anthology of love stories written by First Nations people is in the works with stories of blak love, joy, and connection capitalising on the fastest growing literary genre in the world.

item.title: Donald Trump says US will run Venezuela for now after Nicolás Maduro's capture
item.description: The US will temporarily run Venezuela after American forces captured the country's president and first lady in an extraordinary military strike, US President Donald Trump says.

item.title: Tourists stranded, dozens of roads closed as rain continues in flooded outback Queensland
item.description: Tourists are stranded in towns dotted across north-west Queensland as rain continues to keep major rivers in flood.

item.title: Alex de Minaur unfazed by United Cup loss to Casper Ruud in Australian Open build-up
item.description: Alex de Minaur is not concerned about his Australian Open preparations, believing he can "flip that switch" after recording his first career defeat to Casper Ruud.

item.title: Calls for universal vision screening tests for all SA preschool children
item.description: A group of researchers is calling on the South Australian government to implement a universal vision screening program for all children attending preschools or day care centres.

item.title: Tumbarumba Rodeo celebrates 80 years of bulls, broncos, thrills and spills
item.description: As the Tumbarumba Rodeo celebrates its 80th year, the Rial family have held on for the longest ride of them all.

item.title: How Louis Braille’s musical notation system remains relevant 200 years after its invention
item.description: In the 1820s, Louis Braille devised a raised-dot system of letters, numbers and musical notation. 200 years later, it’s still opening the music world for blind musicians.

item.title: Brisbane man aiming to be fastest person from sea level to Mount Everest summit in memory of late mother
item.description: Oliver Foran struggled with his mental health after losing his mother to cancer. Now, he is training to set a world record while raising money and awareness for youth mental health.

item.title: Scientists, landowners working on Tasmania's Bruny Island to help forty-spotted pardalote species
item.description: Donning a helmet and a well-equipped harness, Dr Fernanda Alves looks like she is set to take on an extreme sport. Instead, she is climbing trees to check nesting boxes for a tiny and very rare bird.

item.title: Former North Melbourne AFL player Phoenix Spicer dies aged 23
item.description: Phoenix Spicer, who played 12 AFL matches for North Melbourne, has died at the age of 23.

item.title: How artificial intelligence is being used across the ACT to provide vital services
item.description: Artificial intelligence is a controversial subject, but as the debate rages it is already being used by ACT government departments, doctors and the people running firefighting operations.

item.title: Top End dams overflow as parks come to life in the wake of Cyclone Fina
item.description: The Northern Territory's Top End has been transformed into a lush green paradise by a cyclone and a monsoon that have brought an unusually heavy start to the annual wet season.

item.title: Collector with 50 pinball machines in his shed hopes to create a playable museum
item.description: This shed in Western Australia is filled wall-to-wall with collectable pinball machines, all in working order. Greg Sharp hopes to one day share it as a playable pinball museum.

item.description: Even in a world that has grown used to a cavalier attitude to international law from Donald Trump, the move stuns leaders across the globe.

item.description: Former Australian Test batsman Damien Martyn is awake and talking after being in an induced coma for several days.

item.title: Cookbook Club Naarm is bringing strangers together over food

item.title: Repeated brain injuries linked to memory changes in intimate partner violence survivors, study finds

item.description: Dragons supporters will have to wait until 2027 to see Keaon Koloamatangi wearing the Red V, but the club describes his signing as the "biggest" in their recent history.

item.title: Woman who lost home in Koolewong bushfire reunited with cat seriously injured in blaze
item.description: Sassy the cat was almost killed when a bushfire razed a Koolewong home on NSW's Central Coast. Now, the lucky pet has been reunited with her family.

item.title: US cuts number of vaccines recommended for children including flu, hepatitis A and B
item.description: The US government takes the unprecedented step of cutting the number of vaccines it recommends for every child, a move long sought by Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr. But medical groups say it undermines protections against diseases.

item.title: Future of historic Paringa Bridge uncertain as it nears 100-year anniversary
item.description: South Australia's only vertical-lift bridge has been unable to rise for more than a week due to a mechanical malfunction, affecting holiday-makers and locals alike.

item.title: Three NFL teams sack coaches on league's traditional Black Monday
item.description: For struggling NFL teams, the end of the regular season triggers an annual exercise in bloodletting known around the league as Black Monday.

item.title: Former Queensland senator Ron 'Bozzie' Boswell dies aged 85
item.description: Known as "Bozzie" to his mates and colleagues, Mr Boswell's political career spanned three decades.

item.title: Man charged in connection to alleged Hanukkah car arson in Melbourne's south-east
item.description: A man is charged after an alleged arson attack on a vehicle with a Hanukkah decoration on Christmas morning in Melbourne's south-east.

item.title: Police appeal for information on 2012 disappearance of Kalgoorlie-Boulder man Charlie Park
item.description: Fourteen years after Charlie Park disappeared in regional WA, detectives have reopened the case and are calling for information from the community.

item.title: BlueScope Steel weighing up $13 billion takeover by Kerry Stokes's SGH and US partner
item.description: Kerry Stokes-controlled firm SGH has launched a $13.2 billion takeover bid for BlueScope Steel, in partnership with a US steelmaker.

item.title: Aboriginal mother of five identified after death in NT police watch house
item.description: A Sydney-based law firm says it is representing the family of a 44-year-old Aboriginal woman who died in custody at the Tennant Creek police watch house.

item.title: Denmark and Greenland PMs condemn Trump's territorial ambitions
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: EU, Britain join condemnation of sexual deepfake images created with Grok AI
item.description: A digital undressing spree on Elon Musk's social media site has prompted investigations from countries including France, India and Malaysia.

item.title: South Australian MP Nick McBride will contest state election after assault charge
item.description: South Australian independent MP Nick McBride says he will run for re-election, as he remains on home detention after spending 10 days behind bars for an alleged assault against his wife.

item.title: Who is Cilia Flores? The woman by Nicolás Maduro's side until Donald Trump threw them in detention
item.description: Her husband Nicolás Maduro calls her Venezuela's "first combatant" because she is not just a spouse, but a fellow fighter in the Chavism movement and a political player in her own right.

item.title: NSW Liberal leader Kellie Sloane announces new shadow cabinet
item.description: The opposition leader says she does not consider the gender breakdown of her shadow ministry, which has 16 men and 10 women.

item.title: Venezuela left as 'potential powder keg' after Maduro capture, experts say
item.description: The US capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has left the country with an uncertain future, sparked concern among regional neighbours and could embolden other countries in territorial disputes, some experts say.

item.title: Madison Keys, Aryna Sabalenka kick off Australian summer of tennis with wins at Brisbane International
item.description: Defending Australian Open champion Madison Keys and last year's runner up Aryna Sabalenka both got their Australian summer off to winning starts with straight-sets victories at the Brisbane International.

item.title: Actor Mickey Rourke turns to crowdfunding to avoid eviction from LA rental
item.description: The actor, who faced accusations of homophobia and inappropriate behaviour on set last year, could now lose his home.

item.title: Anthony Albanese doesn't rule out calling royal commission into Bondi terrorist attack
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese does not rule out calling a royal commission into the Bondi Beach terrorist attack, but says his immediate priority is the review of intelligence and security agencies.

item.title: Here's how sinkholes can form underground long before anyone realises
item.description: The sudden collapse of a sinkhole in Melbourne's north-east left residents shocked on Tuesday. Here's an explanation of how and why they form.

item.title: Public library visitor numbers return to pre-COVID levels as cost-of-living crisis bites
item.description: Public libraries in Australia are experimenting with inventive ways to attract new members — but a lack of funding means they must do more with less.

item.title: After Venezuela, Donald Trump's other threats ring alarms around the world
item.description: Donald Trump is talking about where US forces might venture next. But one of his cabinet secretaries could provide the clearest clues.

item.title: Disappearance of outback woman declared major crime by SA Police
item.description: Investigators hold "grave fears" for Trisha Graf's wellbeing, after she was last seen in the early hours of December 12.

item.title: NSW Police commissioner extends restrictions on Sydney protests for another fortnight
item.description: The NSW police commissioner will extend temporary protest restrictions across Sydney for another two weeks.

item.title: WA Police raid Bunbury tobacconist after suspected firebomb of different vape store
item.description: Police seize vapes and cigarettes from the South West WA store days after two different shops were destroyed.

item.title: Ben Austin died in a cricketing tragedy. His parents Jace and Tracey blame no-one as they speak out for the first time
item.description: Ben Austin died in late October after a being struck by a cricket ball. For the first time his parents speak exclusively about the incident and their belief no-one is to blame for the tragic accident.

item.title: Some NSW farmers say 10 guns are not enough ahead of planned restrictions
item.description: New gun laws in NSW will limit farmers to 10 guns but the industry says this is not enough, and the change could see "a whole lot more firearms and ammunition" moving between farms in vehicles.

item.title: Sam Groth to relinquish deputy Liberal leadership at February party room meeting
item.description: The outgoing MP will vacate the deputy leadership role in February, clearing the way for a refreshed leadership team to carry the opposition to this year's election.

item.title: Bondi terror attack royal commission pressure trumps Albanese's beliefs
item.description: Whether or not Anthony Albanese believes a federal royal commission is necessary, or even the best use of resources, is now politically irrelevant.

item.title: Steve Smith plays his greatest hits as Will Jacks drops sitter and Ben Stokes burns reviews— quick hits from day three of the SCG Test
item.description: Steve Smith plays all his greatest hits en-route to a century as England suffers in the field on all fronts. Here are your quick hits from day three.

item.title: Steve Smith treats Sydney to a Smudge Day, in all its weird and wonderful glory
item.description: Steve Smith was at his bizarre best on day three in Sydney, grinding England into the dust with his scintillating strokeplay and trademark oddness.

item.title: Tuesday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios out of Brisbane International as reality of multiple surgeries hits home
item.description: Nick Kyrgios limped out of the Brisbane International at the first hurdle as the 30-year-old's ailing body lets him down once again.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Jenna the second system to lash Cocos Keeling Islands in less than two weeks
item.description: Residents of the islands clean up following heavy rain and winds brought by Tropical Cyclone Jenna, less than two weeks another system battered the region on Christmas day.

item.title: Human remains found in search for snorkeller missing off WA's Ledge Point
item.description: Police confirm human remains have been found washed ashore north of Perth, believed to be those of a 32-year-old man missing since New Year's Day.

item.title: The tragic death of young cricketer, Ben Austin
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: What are Nicolás Maduro and Cilia Flores alleged to have done?
item.description: The US has justified the seizure of deposed Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and wife Cilia Flores by arguing they had breached US domestic law. So what exactly have they been accused of doing?

item.title: Stuart Clark denies confrontation with Cricket Australia chief Todd Greenberg over controversial comments
item.description: Stuart Clark opens up on his conversation with Cricket Australia chief Todd Greenberg after his stinging criticism.

item.title: Australia books United Cup quarterfinal berth after Alex de Minaur's high-pressure double act
item.description: Twin wins from Alex de Minaur drags Australia off the canvas and into the United Cup quarterfinals with a do-or-die victory over Czechia.

item.title: US set to back Ukraine defence coalition if peace deal made with Russia
item.description: A draft statement outlines what Ukraine's allies could commit to if Russia attacks its neighbour again in the future.

item.title: Fire safety inspections lapsed for years at Swiss bar where 40 died in New Year's blaze
item.description: Swiss authorities admitted that fire safety inspections hadn't been carried out since 2019 at Crans-Montana bar where 40 people died on New Year's Eve.

item.title: European leaders rally behind Greenland amid threats of a Trump takeover
item.description: The US president and his officials are continuing to push for an American takeover of the Danish territory, saying the island is needed for national security.

item.title: Trump's intervention in Venezuela heralds an incomparable era
item.description: The global shock caused by the Trump administration's interventions in Venezuela sent analysts scurrying for historic comparisons, but nothing really compares to what happened at the weekend.

item.title: Total fire ban declared for parts of Victoria and SA as heatwave begins
item.description: Firefighters in Victoria and South Australia are bracing for challenging conditions as a heatwave threatens to bring temperatures of above 45C to some parts of the country.

item.title: Severe heatwave conditions to arrive in Tasmania's north, central and eastern regions
item.description: As Tasmanians make the most of the first heatwave of 2026, authorities are keeping a keen eye on reported high rates of dry grass and other bushfire risks.

item.title: True/false quiz: 10 questions, one choice — will you pass the test?
item.description: Ten questions, one choice: Will you pass the test?

item.title: Today in History, January 7: Guy Menzies walks away from upturned plane after becoming first to fly solo over Tasman
item.description: In 1931, a young pilot named Guy Menzies became the first person to fly solo across the Tasman. It was a secret midnight mission that secured his place in history.

item.title: María Corina Machado vows to return to Venezuela following ousting of Nicolás Maduro by the US
item.description: In her first interview since the ousting of president Nicolás Maduro, María Corina Machado also says she is confident she would win any election held in Venezuela.

item.title: Venezuelans celebrate a future reclaimed — but insiders say the power struggle is just getting started
item.description: Venezuelans are celebrating what once felt impossible — but inside the country, armed powerbrokers, nervous officials and rival factions are already jostling over what comes next.

item.title: Heatwave south-east NSW and east Vic
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Day-by-day weather guide to most severe southern Australia heatwave in years
item.description: Southern Australia will collectively bake this week through the most intense spell of heat in years as temperatures soar up to 15 degrees Celsius above the mid-summer average.

item.title: Angie Fuller disappeared three years ago near a road infamous for missing persons and murders, police remain baffled
item.description: Angie Fuller has been missing for three years. Police are offering an equal record reward for information into what they believe is a suspected outback murder.

item.title: Marion librarians create viral videos to show libraries are about 'more than books'
item.description: The team at Adelaide's City of Marion Libraries grows a legion of fans on social media and sees their videos go viral, clocking up millions of views.

item.title: Venezuela live: Donald Trump confirms plans to meet with oil bosses
item.description: US President Donald Trump says he plans to meet with American oil companies. Follow live.

item.title: Echidna population count underway in Queensland amid urbanisation and climate change fears
item.description: The lack of knowledge about the species has experts worried echidnas could decline without anyone noticing.

item.title: Police search for teenagers after machete attack in Caroline Springs park in Melbourne's west
item.description: Police are seeking help from the public to identify a group of teenagers wanted over what detectives have described as an ambush and machete attack in Caroline Springs, in Melbourne's west, last week.

item.title: Push for QVB's colourful glass to be made clear for more 'visibility' into stores
item.description: Dozens of people have expressed opposition against a proposal to remove some of Queen Victoria Building's iconic coloured glass windows, after a development application stated they were not "fit for purpose in the eyes of global retail brands".

item.title: Australians trapped on Yemeni island Socotra after Saudi Arabia, UAE flare-up
item.description: Australians are among hundreds of tourists scrambling to leave a remote Yemeni island, as a crisis on the mainland between Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates causes travel chaos.

item.title: Berry Street residential care staff fear being 'drug affected' at work due to high ice use
item.description: Emails show staff working at Berry Street residential care homes may have been exposed to ice by children using drugs at its facilities.

item.title: Half of Canberra's Commonwealth Avenue Bridge is closing for two years. Here's what you need to know
item.description: Commuters in Canberra are facing major disruptions as Commonwealth Avenue Bridge undergoes two years of major upgrades.

item.title: Gulf Country prepares for weeks of isolation, as north-east Qld coast braces for tropical low
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology said there is a "moderate chance" that a tropical low could reach cyclone strength in Far North Queensland in the next few days.

item.title: Fire on southern NSW property likely sparked by cigarette butt
item.description: A southern NSW landholder is urging smokers to think twice when disposing of their cigarette butts, after a grassfire razed her property.

item.title: Insurer Prosura hit by cyber data breach, customers contacted by 'threat actor'
item.description: Australians who have rented cars have been caught up in a cyber incident affecting excess insurer Prosura, with customers receiving modified invoices from a self-proclaimed "threat actor".

item.title: Ajla Tomljanović departs Brisbane International as Rinky Hijikata advances
item.description: Australia's Ajla Tomljanović loses a tense three-set match to world number 20 Karolína Muchová, while Rinky Hijikata is the last remaining local hope in the men's draw.
